cloudfront features to deliver your website um with a focus on the features

content Dynamic content is uh the stuff that changes from users to user so you
see here this is a screenshot we've from the amazon.com retail site uh Jared who gave the introduction um this is his
amazon.com so you can see his name in the upper left of the screenshot on the other hand um static content is the

Modern Family Image that that's there in the center that's considered static content because all the users get the
same content let's drill into those in a little more detail so we define static content as the objects on your website
that don't change from user to
user these include images um media files audio scripts um so again the key thing
here is that these are the the objects that don't change from user to user everyone gets the same one Dynamic
content in contrast is the interactive or personalized portion of the website that's created on the Fly for each end
user so this could be the customer's name like Jared's name on the screenshot we saw earlier or personalized
information uh things that we tend to see news weather people want the weather where they are so personalization and
weather and sort of the news stories are very important sport scores stock quotes travel information all of these things
are very personal and they change from user to user so the old way uh for delivering
Dynamic content customers had what we consider to be two um bad choices the first was to use their own origin server
and to deliver content directly from those origin servers so basically not use a CDN as all this was slow um this
was hard to scale you had to make sure that your origin infrastructure was up to the load that uh a potential flash
crowd could put on it it intr single points of fail failure and um was
expensive it had you had to handle that LIF um on the other hand uh there were solutions from traditional content
delivery networks uh that worked for dynamic content but these were expensive they were complicated to configure and
they often required proprietary coding in order to get them to work so we built some features into
Amazon cloudfront for dynamic content with really three tenants in mind the first was to make it simple to use uh we
wanted a uh service that you could configure yourself using our web console
uh no Consultants should be necessary there shouldn't be any proprietary languages to learn uh we wanted to build
a product that was integrated with other
a US service connectivity between the Amazon Cloud front edge locations and
the aw US regions very closely and we allow um cloudfront resources to be
configured uh with standard AWS tools like Amazon cloud formation that can
provide uh scripting to set up your cloudfront distributions plus your origin finally uh we wanted the service
to be lowc cost and this is very consistent with how Amazon has approached the web services business
overall uh we didn't want you to pay um any additional charges
uh so for dynamic content so there's no setup fees or upfront charges uh we only wanted customers to pay for requests and
data transfer uh and in fact we made the decision to price it at the same rates that we charged for static
delivery so how it works um there's two layers of optimizations here uh the first uh two layers of network
optimization uh the first is between the user and the cloudfront edge location um
so like our static content um or any kind of content um we will choose
the location that is best positioned to serve um an end user based on low

the edge location and the end user uh between cloudfront and the origin um we
have features that allow the uh separation of static and dynamic content

to make sure that the longdistance um path over the Internet is over a um
connection that we monitor uh for reliability and performance we do collapse forward
requests um so if you get multiple requests if single edge location gets multiple requests for the same piece of

number a scenario would mean essentially having a silo infrastructure that could

during s very quickly make some adjustments on the Fly uh to free up
